p: The overall proportion of laboratory confirmed influenza positive medically-attended ILI cases among patients presented to the sentinel sites (health facility) seeking medical care for any kind of illness (total admission rate) were 0.82% (824.6 per 100, 000 total admitted patients [95%CI; 44.39, 1604.79]).The mean annual proportion was 0.16% (160.04 per 100, 000 of total admitted patients). The higher influenza positive case proportion was recorded in 2013 by 0.26% (R = 261.7; 95%CI; 6.57, 516.76] followed by an influenza positive case proportion of 0.2% (R = 191.1 in 2014 [95% CI; 48.35, 333.95] per 100,000 population of total admission (Fig. 3, below). Medically attended influenza positive case proportion were high (2.5%) in the age group between 5 and 14 years of age [R = 2496.1, 95% CI; 1715.92, 3276.32] followed by 1% in the age group of 15–44 [R = 1009.0, 95% CI; 228.80, 1789.20] per 100,000 of total admitted patients (Table 3, below). Figure 3 below illustrates the proportion of medically attended ILI cases (number of influenza positive cases per total admitted patients) and incidence rate of medically attended ILI per 100, 000 population in the catchment area.
